targets.expr: sum(avg_over_time(oracledb_ora_metric_value{metric_name="Database Time Per Sec"}[$__range]) / 100) by (alias, instance, job)

sum(avg_over_time(oracledb_ora_metric_value{metric_name="Database Time Per Sec"}[$__range] offset $diff_intv) / 100) by (alias, instance, job)
>= ((1-$use_diff)*100000000000000000000000000000000000000000)

sum(avg_over_time(oracledb_ora_metric_value{metric_name="Host CPU Utilization (%)"}[$__range] offset $diff_intv) / 100) by (alias, instance, job)
>= ((1-$use_diff)*100000000000000000000000000000000000000000)

ceil(avg_over_time(oracledb_ora_metric_value{metric_name="Host CPU Usage Per Sec"}[$__range]) / ignoring(metric_name) 
     avg_over_time(oracledb_ora_metric_value{metric_name="Host CPU Utilization (%)"}[$__range]))

panels.description:
- The total wait time of the summarized events that are timed.
- = Active session
panels.title: State

targets.expr:
avg_over_time(oracledb_ora_metric_value{alias=~"$alias", metric_name="CPU Usage Per Sec"}[$intv]) / ignoring(metric_name) 
(
avg_over_time(oracledb_ora_metric_value{alias=~"$alias", metric_name="Host CPU Usage Per Sec"}[$intv]) / ignoring(metric_name) 
avg_over_time(oracledb_ora_metric_value{alias=~"$alias", metric_name="Host CPU Utilization (%)"}[$intv])
)

avg_over_time(oracledb_ora_metric_value{alias=~"$alias", metric_name="CPU Usage Per Sec"}[$intv] offset $diff_intv) / ignoring(metric_name) 
(
avg_over_time(oracledb_ora_metric_value{alias=~"$alias", metric_name="Host CPU Usage Per Sec"}[$intv] offset $diff_intv) / ignoring(metric_name) 
avg_over_time(oracledb_ora_metric_value{alias=~"$alias", metric_name="Host CPU Utilization (%)"}[$intv] offset $diff_intv)
)
>= ((1-$use_diff)*100000000000000000000000000000000000000000)

panels.description: DB Time = CPU Time + Wait Time
panels.title: DB Time (s)

panels.description: DB Time = CPU Time + Wait Time
panels.title: Wait Time (s)

panels.description: Sum of all SQL execution times per second
panels.title: SQL Time (s)

panels.description: Sum of all SQL execution times per second
panels.title: SQL Exec.

panels.description:
Logical Reads  = DB Block Gets + Consistent Read Gets
This metric represents the number of logical reads per second.
A logical read is a read request for a data block from the SGA. 
Logical reads may result in a physical read if the requested block does not reside with the buffer cache.
panels.title: L Reads (blks)

panels.description:
This metric represents the number of data blocks read from disk per second.
When a user performs a SQL query, Oracle tries to retrieve the data from the database buffer cache (memory) first, then searches the disk if it is not already in memory.
panels.title: P Reads (blks)

panels.description:
Tablespace average read time
= readtim_ms / phyrds
panels.title: IO avg read (ms)

panels.description:
Tablespace average write time
= writetim_ms / phywrts
panels.title: IO avg write (ms)
